body:
You can use this service to apply for a court order about your child arrangements in England and Wales.

(i) The process is different in [Scotland]({app:urls:url:court-process-scotland}) and [Northern Ireland]({app:urls:url:court-process-northern-ireland}).

## Before you apply

You should see if you can resolve your dispute another way, for example through mediation.

There's usually a better outcome for children if you can reach an agreement without going to court.

A court will make an order based on what is best for your children. This might mean you won’t get the outcome you’re after.

If you’re worried about your or your children’s safety you should continue with this application.

[Compare alternatives to court]({app:urls:url:cait})

## Fees

It costs £215 to apply. Only the applicant (the person applying to court) needs to pay.

You may be able to [get help paying the fee]({app:urls:url:help-with-fees}) if you’re on a low income, receive certain benefits or have little or no savings. Apply online before you start if you think you're eligible.
heading: Apply to court about your child arrangements
xlede: Make an application under section 8 of the Children Act 1989 for a child arrangements, prohibited steps, specific issue order or to vary or discharge or ask permission to make a section 8 order
